main event: A UFO was observed visually moving fast, heading northeast from the observer before being obscured by clouds. It was later identified as a star by multiple sources.
interesting points: The UFO was observed by a civilian in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 1954.
The object appeared round, yellow-orange, and was observed by three individuals in formation.
A number of phone calls were made to the police, and the object was identified as a star, although it was noted to be lower than other star observations.
The sighting occurred at the Sears-Roebuck on Roosevelt Blvd in Philadelphia, PA.
The UFO was also observed and reported by a naval air station tower controller, who claimed to have never seen a similar object unless it was some top-secret military device.
result: prosaic explanation - the UFO was identified as a star by multiple sources.
sighted object: one UFO observed visually moving fast
witnesses: civilian, naval air station tower controller, police department personnel
